docs.snippet: SEERY--Carol Ranney, 88, on July 7. Graduated College of St. Rose, 1949 and received masters degree from Boston College. Nuclear engineer and co-author of Reactor Shielding Design Manual (1956), math teacher, hospital volunteer. Survived by husban...
docs.lead_paragraph:
SEERY--Carol Ranney,

88, on July 7. Graduated College of St. Rose, 1949 and received masters degree from Boston College. Nuclear engineer and co-author of Reactor Shielding Design Manual (1956), math teacher, hospital volunteer. Survived by husband Jim, children Florie, Jimmy and Michael, sister Mary Aileen and grandchildren Grace, Maggie, Lucy, Seamus, Owen, Angela, Alasdair and Kate. Funeral July 14, 11am at Church of the Epiphany, 375 2nd Ave. Memorial contribution may be made to: Camphillfoundation.org.

docs.snippet: FARRINGTON--Sylvia Stark. Flight attendant turned book indexer, lover of dachshunds, raspberries, jazz, theater and all things New York, Sylvia Stark Farrington died June 30 while hospitalized near her summer home in Center Harbor, New Hampshire. ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
FARRINGTON--Sylvia Stark.

Flight attendant turned book indexer, lover of dachshunds, raspberries, jazz, theater and all things New York, Sylvia Stark Farrington died June 30 while hospitalized near her summer home in Center Harbor, New Hampshire. Born in Santa Clara, Cuba, November 16, 1926, to an American father and Cuban mother, she joined Pan American in its glory days to see the world. While airborne she met the love of her life-- whom she noticed because he was reading D.H. Lawrence--and with whom she traveled widely. Africa was a favorite destination. She is survived by her pilot husband, Robert "Bob" Farrington, extended family in Texas and Florida, and a wide circle of friends who will miss her keen intelligence, dry wit and loving embrace.

docs.snippet: EDSALL--John R. Columbia University Medical Center and NewYork- Presbyterian celebrate the life and mourn the passing of John R. Edsall, M.D., longtime pulmonologist and Clinical Professor of Medicine. His talent, expertise and compassion will lon...
docs.lead_paragraph:
EDSALL--John R.

Columbia University Medical Center and NewYork- Presbyterian celebrate the life and mourn the passing of John R. Edsall, M.D., longtime pulmonologist and Clinical Professor of Medicine. His talent, expertise and compassion will long be remembered by his patients, by those who benefited from his tutelage, and from those fortunate to have known him as a colleague and friend. The John Edsall-John Wood Asthma Center in the Division of Pulmonary, Allergy and Critical Care Medicine serves as an apt and enduring tribute to his life and work. We offer our condolences to his wife, Peggy; his children; and the extended Edsall family. Lee Goldman, M.D. Executive Vice President and Dean of the Faculties of Health Sciences and Medicine, Chief Executive, Columbia University Medical Center Steven J. Corwin, M.D. President and CEO, NewYork-Presbyterian

docs.snippet: POWERS--Peter J. The board and staff of United Hospital Fund are deeply saddened by the loss of this extraordinary man and good friend, who provided wise counsel and strategic leadership for more than a decade as a valued member of our board and a...
docs.lead_paragraph:
POWERS--Peter J. The board and staff of United Hospital Fund are deeply saddened by the loss of this extraordinary man and good friend, who provided wise counsel and strategic leadership for more than a decade as a valued member of our board and as the deeply respected chairman of our budget, audit, and operations committee. His careful stewardship was matched by his steadfast commitment to UHF's mission and the imperative of investing in new ideas and programs to build a more effective health care system for every New Yorker. He has left a strong imprint on our city and UHF, and will be greatly missed.

  J. Barclay Collins II Chairman James R. Tallon, Jr. President

docs.snippet: LIEBMANN--Lisa Isabel, born in 1955, passed peacefully at home on June 30. Daughter of the late Herman Liebmann and Loraine Pack Liebmann. Lisa was a respected art critic and writer often with her husband Brooks Adams who survives her as does thei...
docs.lead_paragraph:
LIEBMANN--Lisa Isabel,

born in 1955, passed peacefully at home on June 30. Daughter of the late Herman Liebmann and Loraine Pack Liebmann. Lisa was a respected art critic and writer often with her husband Brooks Adams who survives her as does their daughter Jane Juno and her mother. A light has gone out and Lisa will be forever missed.

docs.snippet: WOODYATT--Lois Hoxie, November 3, 1915 - July 4, 2016. She was married to Philip Crandon Woodyatt. She worked all her life at the Dalton School, the Anne Andrews Employment Agency, as personal assistant to Dr. Benjamin Spock, at the National Acade...
docs.lead_paragraph:
WOODYATT--Lois Hoxie,

November 3, 1915 - July 4, 2016. She was married to Philip Crandon Woodyatt. She worked all her life at the Dalton School, the Anne Andrews Employment Agency, as personal assistant to Dr. Benjamin Spock, at the National Academy of Design and at the Cooper Hewitt Design Museum. Her favorite was working in radio news during the war. Lois was a world traveler and the beloved friend of many, a wide community of admirers whose lives were enriched by her wisdom and biting wit. Her stories were better than anyone's but when she talked to you, it was about you, never herself. Her daughters, Rolly and Rachel; her son-in-law Emilio; her grandchildren, William, Abigail, Catherine, and Alessia; her grand-son-in-law, Felice; and her great-grandchildren Gabriele and Anna join all her friends in thanking her for sharing her wonderful life with us.

docs.snippet: SAXE--Robert L. Scientist and businessman Bob Saxe was considered to be the father of the smart window industry. He passed away at age 81 on June 29, 2016, and is survived by his brother Stephen O. Saxe. Bob was married for 34 years to Marie Posne...
docs.lead_paragraph:
SAXE--Robert L.

Scientist and businessman Bob Saxe was considered to be the father of the smart window industry. He passed away at age 81 on June 29, 2016, and is survived by his brother Stephen O. Saxe. Bob was married for 34 years to Marie Posner Saxe, an apparel industry executive who passed away in 2008. Robert Saxe started Research Frontiers Inc. over 50 years ago, and is the principal inventor on many of its patents. Under his leadership, the company achieved world-wide recognition as the premier developer of SPD-Smart light control technology currently licensed to over 40 companies, including most of the world's automotive glass producers. It is used in automobiles, aircraft, yachts, homes and offices, and museums, and was prominently featured at the most recent World's Fair in Milan. At the time of his death, Mr. Saxe was Research Frontiers' Chairman of the Board and Chief Technology Officer Mr. Saxe's published work on the nature of light allows scientists to derive several key fundamental constants used by physicists. He graduated from Harvard College in 1956 with an A.B. degree, Cum Laude in General Studies (with a major in physics) and received an M.B.A. degree from Harvard Business School in 1960. His technology makes cars, homes, offices, and aircraft more energy efficient, comfortable, and safer. Bob Saxe took great pride in the benefits that his SPD-SmartGlass technology brought to many industries, and the way it improved people's lives. A Memorial Service will be held at the Frank E. Campbell Funeral Chapel at 1076 Madison Avenue in Manhattan on July 13, 2016 at 6:00pm.

docs.snippet: LADKA--Wendy June, May 30, 1954 - July 3, 2016 She had been a resident of Long Beach, NY. She leaves behind her mother, Dorothy Ladka, nephew Christopher Ladka and brother, Kerry Ladka as well as her partner, Patrick Dunworth. Words cannot express...
docs.lead_paragraph:
LADKA--Wendy June,

May 30, 1954 - July 3, 2016 She had been a resident of Long Beach, NY. She leaves behind her mother, Dorothy Ladka, nephew Christopher Ladka and brother, Kerry Ladka as well as her partner, Patrick Dunworth. Words cannot express the depth of our sorrow.
